means: 广场恐怖症，旷野恐怖症，陌生环境恐怖症

word_mean: 〔SDM-Ⅲ〕广场恐怖，旷野恐怖：对开放性空间的不合情理的极度恐惧，这是一种复杂的恐惧症，特征为患者对孤独以及公共场所的明显恐惧，惟恐一旦发生可怕事件，不能逃避，无人救援。患者为求避免进入这样的境地，致使其正常活动严重受限，如他(她)可能一直呆在家里，除非有亲友为伴，决不外出
有些患者甚至可因预计要接触公共场所而恐慌不已

sentence.Network_en: After the agoraphobia - inducing space of the city, this room looked suffocatingly small.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过了这个城市有诱导作用的恐怖空旷空间后, 这个房间看起来小的让人窒息.

sentence.Network_en: Object To explore the effect of Eclectic Psychotherapy in agoraphobia.
sentence.Network_cn: 目的探索综合心理疗法对场所恐惧症的效果.

sentence.Network_en: Conclusion Eclectic Psychotherapy is an efficient way for treating agoraphobia, is worth promoting the application.
sentence.Network_cn: 结论综合心理疗法是治疗场所恐惧症的行之有效的方法, 值得推广应用.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from Greek agora 'place of assembly, marketplace' + -phobia

entry.tran: 广场（或旷野）恐怖（症）；恐旷症;公共场所恐惧症
entry.def: Agoraphobia is the fear of open or public places.

means.word_mean: 1. a morbid fear of open spaces (as fear of being caught alone in some public place)

auth_sentence.content: Renoir, played by the wonderful Michel Bouquet, suffered no such agoraphobia.

auth_sentence.content: She suffered from agoraphobia, and she didn't go out without him.

auth_sentence.content: He hated to drive or fly his agoraphobia and anxiety growing worse over the course of his life.
